docs.text: capsule : where are you tonight , leni rienfenstal ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: starship troopers is an expensive , hateful and unenjoyable piece of violent pornography -- and bad pornography , at that .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it is not good cinema , not good storytelling , and not even stupid fun : it's so cynically , calculatedly bone-headed that even the least demanding members of the audience i was with were alternately bored and revulsed .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it's one of the worst movies i've seen in a long time .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: why am i calling this movie pornography ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: pornography , in the abstract , is anything which is calculated to appeal to the baser instincts .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i remember reading a review of full metal jacket which described the climact moment at the end of the movie , where private joker has to shoot the downed vc sniper , as " a near-pornographic eternity " .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i didn't agree with that assessment , but i could see what was being implied : the reviewer felt as if the audience was being incited to stand up and pump their fists and shout " do 'er , man , do 'er ! "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: that sentiment is echoed ad nauseam throughout starship troopers .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it's * literally * like a giant recruitment film that has gone berserk .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it tries frantically to enlist our emotions but it winds up only being dull or sickening .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the film takes place in our future , when earth has come under attack by some alien species that doesn't appear to have intelligence .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: to counterattack , humankind does the single stupidest thing imaginable : instead of nuke the planet from orbit , which they're clearly capable of , they send down grunts with m-16 rifles .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this isn't heinlein , it's a bad wwii movie , one where all the most obvious points of satire are ever poked and prodded in combat scenes that are noisy , repetitive , and ultimately tiresome .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: ( one scene has a journalist on a battlefield , filimg soldiers being slaughtered , and ends with groaning predictability : said cameraman gets skewered , too . )
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the soldiers and their commanders are consistently idiotic .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: they do not possess a germ of tactical intelligence or even common sense .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: they don't even behave like soldiers in a bad * movie * , and therefore we don't care about them .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: we hated the tom berenger character in platoon , but he * mattered * , and therefore we were curious to learn about his fate .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: here , we don't even hate the bugs -- what's there to hate ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: hating them would be like cursing a hurricaine .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: if there's anything really hateful there , the movie doesn't know how to give it to us .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the screenwriter ( ed neumeier -- perhaps a better appelation would be " screen typist " ) and director ( the increasingly talent-impaired paul verhoeven ) have not found any way to make the characters or the story serve each other .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: one of the subplots concerns a woman pilot who's great at getting out of tight situations , and does it again and again and again .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: once or twice is fine .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: by the fifth or sixth time , it's worn out its welcome .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: there's never any sense that these people are really thinking their way out of anything , or really being tested to show their mettle .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: also , the movie is irritatingly selective with how effective the bugs are to earthling weaponry .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: if a bug has one of the humans screaming in its grasp , then five guys can stand around it and blast away on full auto without doing a damned thing .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but if one human gets cornered , he lays waste to whole platoons of bugs with one clip .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: uh-huh .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the very worst feature of the movie is its repulsive quasi-fascist flavor .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i say " quasi- " because while the movie uses many of the trappings of fascism ot eroticize its action -- the gear , the uniforms , etc . -- the movie doesn't have the nerve ( or the brains ) to be genuinely fascist , or intelligent about the subject .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the bumpers between scenes , which are apparently intended to parody wartime recruitment propaganda are propaganda -- just so clumsy and oafish that they wind up making the bugs look relatively innocuous in comparison .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: like the rest of the movie .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: there's more , i suppose , but it's not worth it .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the acting is bland , neither arsenic nor gravy ; the music disposable ; the camerawork turgid .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the heartbreaking thing is that it makes independence day look like a masterpiece .
docs.label: negative
